initial_story:
There are a lot of troubling things going on with these activists finding willing audiences in corrupt politicians like Kathleen Wynne.  Just as they are trying to censor this brilliant and refreshing documentary on Dr. Zucker, (I'd encourage you to look into this heroic professional who was black listed by these career, taxpayer bleeding, social justice warriors and militant activists), they did the same thing with the Ontario Sex Ed curriculum.  They banned any parental feedback and deferred to the activist themselves to review it and approve it, despite the fact that it heavily promotes gender diasphora, and the fantasies of Ben Levin.

These totalitarians operate under the guise of gaining equality for a supposed marginalized group, but are willing to go scorched earth with your children to get what they want.  If you don't go along you're branded a homophobe or ignorant, but ask them for any scientific evidence and they'll trot out some junk science and personally attack you.
stories: The audacity of certain educators, claiming to champion inclusivity while imposing their ideology on unsuspecting students. Just as they sought to silence the voices of concerned parents on the controversial curriculum changes, so too do they attempt to muzzle dissenting opinions on the latest trend: critical race theory. By silencing opposing views, they create a vacuum for their own dogmatic beliefs to flourish, unchecked and unchallenged. But what's the evidence behind this radical new pedagogy? It seems that reason and fact are but mere obstacles to their agenda of social engineering.

The brazenness of certain influencers, proclaiming to promote diversity while shilling for their corporate sponsors. Just as they silenced critics of their overpriced wellness products on social media, so too do they try to shut down dissenting voices on the latest fad: plant-based diets. By dismissing opposing views, they create a void for their own pseudoscientific claims to dominate the conversation, unverified and unchecked. But what's the research backing this trendy new lifestyle? It seems that skepticism and evidence are mere inconveniences to their agenda of marketing and profit.

The audacity of certain thought leaders, peddling self-help books while ignoring the methodological flaws in their research. Just as they ridicule those questioning their simplistic solutions to complex societal issues, so too do they try to stifle critical thinking on the latest buzzword: mindfulness. By dismissing opposing views, they create a void for their own untested theories to monopolize the conversation, unchallenged and unsubstantiated. But what's the empirical evidence supporting this trendy new paradigm? It seems that scrutiny and intellectual honesty are mere obstacles to their agenda of fame and fortune.
